moves.7... Kd7 8. Be6+ Ke8 9. Bxg4 e5: My preferred move at this point, it frees the bishop and opens up lines for the Q.
moves.10. O-O exf4 11. Nxe4 Qd4+: Black wants to tie White down.
moves.15. Bxh5+ Kd7 16. Bg4+ Kc7 17. d3 Nd7 18: Black counters the threat on the rank.
moves.22. Rxe8 Rxe8 23. Re1 Rxe1+ 24. Bxe1: White's strategy has been to exchange pieces, hoping that the Q can be constrained.
moves.25. Na4 Qb5 26. b3 Qf5 27. Nf2: ?? This is the first move that the computer shows as a serious error. Now the Black Q can exploit the weakness of White's K position. Better was h3.
moves.27... b5: ?! According to the computer, ...Qe5! immediately is stronger, i.e., ...Qe5 27. Bc3 Qe2 28. Nh3 Bxc3 29. Nxc3 Qe1+ 30. Ng1 Qxc3 31. h3 Qxc2 32. Nf3 Qxa2 33. b4 Qb1+ 34. Kh2 Qxb4 35. Nxg5, although this move still gains an advantage.
moves.29... b4: Black wants to force his way into the back rank.
moves.30. Nd1 Qa1 31. Nef2 Bd4: ! This move ensures the win of a piece. If Kg1, QxN! because of the pin. Otherwise, ...BxN followed by QxB will win. White resigns.
